page.title: Supreme Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation

revision.text:
{{Infobox Political post |post = The Supreme Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation
Верховный главнокомандующий Вооружёнными Силами Российской Федерации |insignia = Эмблема Верховного глвнокомандующего ВС России.jpg{{!}}border |insigniasize = 125px |insigniacaption = Official emblem of the Supreme Commander-in-Chief |flag = Flag of Commander-in-chief of Russia.svg |flagsize = 125px |flagcaption = Flag of the Supreme Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation |image = Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin (2nd Presidency).jpg |imagesize = 165px |incumbent = [[Vladimir Putin]] |incumbentsince = 7 May 2012 |style = Comrade Supreme Commander |residence = [[Kremlin Senate]] |seat = [[Moscow]] |succession = |appointer = Function takes the current president of Russia |termlength = Six years
(one consecutive re-election) |formation = 7 May 1992 |inaugural = [[Boris Yeltsin]] |salary = |website = {{ru icon}} [http://президент.рф/ президент.рф]
{{en icon}} [http://eng.kremlin.ru/ eng.kremlin.ru] }} The Supreme [[Commander-in-Chief]] of the [[Armed Forces of the Russian Federation]] ({{lang-ru|Верховный Главнокомандующий Вооружёнными Силами Российской Федерации}}) is the [[President of Russia]] in accordance with Article 87 of the [[Constitution of Russia|Russian Constitution]]. ==Legal basis== [[File:Владимир Путин в Национальном центре управления обороной Российской Федерации (зал управления и взаимодействия).jpeg|thumb|right|Supreme Commander-in-Chief Vladimir Putin at [[the National Defense Management Center]]. December 19, 2014]] [[File:Dmitry Medvedev in Kamchatka Krai 25 September 2008-9.jpg|thumb|right|Supreme Commander-in-Chief Dmitry Medvedev on missile submarine strategic K-433 "St. George the Victorious". September 25, 2008]] On May 7, 1992 Russian President [[Boris Yeltsin]] issued a [[Decree of the President of Russia|decree]] №467 "On taking office, the Supreme Commander of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation".[http://document.kremlin.ru/doc.asp?ID=092697 Указ Президента Российской Федерации от 7 мая 1992 года № 467 «О вступлении в должность Верховного Главнокомандующего Вооружёнными Силами Российской Федерации»] Powers of the President, as Commander In Chief, assigned by the Law of the Russian Federation of December 9, 1992 № 4061-I "On changes and amendments to the Constitution of the Russian Federation".[http://www.kodeks-luks.ru/ciws/printdoc?tid=&nd=901604755&prevDoc=901700028 Закон Российской Федерации от 9 декабря 1992 года № 4061-I «Об изменениях и дополнениях Конституции (Основного Закона) Российской Федерации — России»] On December 25, 1993 the current Constitution of Russia entered into force, which confirmed the status of the President as the Supreme Commander-in-Chief. ==Powers== In accordance with Article 83 of the Constitution of the Russian Federation Supreme Commander-in-Chief: #Approves military doctrine of the Russian Federation #Appoints and dismiss the Supreme Command of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation. In accordance with Article 4 of the Federal law "On Defense" Supreme Commander-in Chief has a power to: #Determine the main directions of military policy of the Russian Federation; #Provide guidance to the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation, other troops, military formations and bodies; #In the case of aggression or direct threat of aggression against the Russian Federation or the emergence of armed conflict against the Russian Federation, Supreme Commander-in-Chief announces general or partial mobilization, announces martial law on the territory of the Russian Federation or in particular areas of Russian Federation and notifies the Federation Council and the State Duma immediately and issues a decree on the conduct of military operations; #Enact regulations of war and cease their action, form and abolish executive authorities for a period of war in accordance with federal constitutional law on martial law; #In accordance with federal laws, make the decision on bringing the Russian Armed Forces, other troops, military formations and bodies to carry out tasks with the use of weapons, not by their intended use; #Approve: ##the concepts and plans for the construction and development of the Russian Federation Armed Forces, other troops, military formations and bodies; ##the Plan of the Russian Armed Forces; ##mobilization plan of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation; ##plans for the transfer (mobilization plans) of work of public authorities of the Russian Federation, bodies of state power of subjects of the Russian Federation, local self-government and the economy during the wartime; ##plans to create reserves wealth of state and mobilization reserves; ##federal government program for operational equipment in the Russian Federation for purposes of defence; #Approve federal government programs of weapons and the development of defense industrial complex; #Approve nuclear programs and other special tests, and authorizes these tests; #Approve a single list of military posts to be filled by senior officers in the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation, other troops, military formations and bodies, and the total number of military posts to be filled by colonels (captains 1st rank) in the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation, other troops, military formations and bodies, confers high military ranks, appoint personnel to the military posts, for which the state provides the higher ranks of officers, freeing them from their military posts and dismiss them from military service in the manner prescribed by federal law; #Approve the structure of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation, other troops, military formations up to and including associations and bodies, as well as the number of staff members of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation, other troops, military formations and bodies; #Make decision on the deployment and redeployment of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation, other troops, military formations from the link above; #Approve military regulations, the regulations of the battle flag of the military, naval ensign of the Russian Federation, the order of military service, military councils, the military police stations, military transport duties; #Approve the regulations of the Ministry of Defence and the General Staff of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation, as well as provisions on the management bodies of other troops, military formations and bodies; #Approve regulations on territorial defense and civil defense plan; #Approve plans to deploy in the Russian Federation with nuclear warheads, as well as facilities for the elimination of weapons of mass destruction and nuclear waste; #Negotiate and sign international treaties of the Russian Federation in the field of defense, including treaties of mutual defense, collective security, the reduction and limitation of armed forces and armaments, on the participation of the Russian Armed Forces in peacekeeping and international security; #Issue [[Decree of the President of Russia|decree]]s on conscription of Russian Federation citizens for military service, military training (with the number of recruits Russian citizens and their distribution between the Russian Federation Armed Forces, other troops, military formations and bodies), as well as dismissal from the military service of citizens of the Russian Federation of passing military service in the manner prescribed by federal law; #Limit the number of members of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation, other troops, military formations and bodies on secondment to the federal authorities; #Exercise other powers in the field of defense, entrusted to him by the Constitution of the Russian Federation, federal constitutional laws, federal laws and laws of the Russian Federation. ==Symbols== September 21, 1995 Minister of Defence of the Russian Federation approved a sketch of the flag of the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Russia. The flag follows the pattern of the Standard of the President of the Russian Federation, but has a 2:3 aspect ratio.[http://www.vexillographia.ru/russia/mod_pres.htm Флаги Президента России] The flag is raised on the ships of the [[Russian Navy]] when the Supreme Commander is on board. On May 5, 2009, Russian President Dmitry Medvedev has established an official emblem of the Supreme Commander-in-Chief.[http://document.kremlin.ru/doc.asp?ID=52228&PSC=1&PT=3&Page=1 Указ Президента Российской Федерации от 5 мая 2009 года № 502 «Об учреждении эмблемы Верховного Главнокомандующего Вооружёнными Силами Российской Федерации»] ==List== {{Main|List of presidents of Russia}} {| class="wikitable" |- !№ !Portrait !Name !colspan="2" |Term of office !Length of term !Military rank !Branch |- !1 |[[File:Борис Николаевич Ельцин.jpg|100px]] |[[Boris Yeltsin]] |May 7, 1992 |December 31, 1999 |{{age in years and days|1992|5|7|1999|12|31}} |No military rank |None |- !2 |[[File:Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin.jpg|100px]] |[[Vladimir Putin]] |December 31, 1999 |May 7, 2008 |{{age in years and days|1999|12|31|2008|5|7}} |[[Lieutenant colonel]] |[[KGB|Committee for State Security]]
(1975–1991)
[[Federal Security Service]]
(1998–1999) |- !3 |[[File:Dmitry Anatolyevich Medvedev.jpg|100px]] |[[Dmitry Medvedev]] |May 7, 2008 |May 7, 2012 |{{age in years and days|2008|5|7|2012|5|7}} |No military rank |None |- !4 |[[File:Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin (2nd Presidency).jpg|100px]] |[[Vladimir Putin]] |May 7, 2012 |Incumbent |{{age in years and days|2012|5|7}} |[[Lieutenant colonel]] |[[KGB|Committee for State Security]]
(1975–1991)
[[Federal Security Service]]
(1998–1999) |} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Armed Forces of the Russian Federation}} {{Russia topics}} [[Category:Russian commanders in chief]] [[Category:Russian law]] [[Category:Politics of Russia]] [[Category:1992 establishments in Russia]] [[Category:Commanders in chief|Russian Federation]]
